comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: DL Cease was longtime editor of the Railroad Trainman, and served on various advisory boards to do with railroad workers' wages, safety, and other employment conditions.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: In the news in 1913 as an appointed member (with Seth Low, W. W. Atterbury, and others) of an arbitration board established by act of Congress to mediate an impending railway strike.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: I started an article on him in Wikipedia: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_L._Cease I haven't been able to come up with his middle name.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Everyone,

Thanks for the additional details on Mr. Cease. We will expand the record when we update.
